title:
Relative monodromy of abelian logarithms for finite covers of universal
  families
abstract:
Let's fix a complex abelian scheme endowed with a non-torsion section and
with a finite surjective modular map onto a universal family of abelian
varieties (with some fixed level-$\ell$-structure and without locally constant
parts). We show that the relative monodromy group of the abelian logarithm is
non-trivial and of full rank. As a consequence we deduce a new proof of Manin's
kernel theorem and of the algebraic independence of the coordinates of abelian
logarithms with respect to the coordinates of periods.
